name: Wheat
details: Wheat is a cereal grain that serves as a staple food for many cultures. Domesticated over 10,000 years ago, it is used in a variety of applications such as bread, pasta, cakes, and beer production. Its nutritional profile includes essential fibers, proteins, and nutrients like manganese, phosphorus, and selenium. Wheat thrives in temperate climates and requires careful moisture management, particularly during its growing and maturation phases. It is also an important source of bran and germ, which are rich in antioxidants and vitamins.
weather: Moderate temperature, prefers 12-25°C with dry weather during maturity.
soil_type: Loamy or clayey soil with good drainage.
water_requirements: Low to moderate irrigation required during germination and growth stages.

name: Rice
details: Rice is a globally significant staple food for over half of the world’s population, primarily in Asia. It is a versatile crop, with varieties such as short-grain, long-grain, and glutinous rice. Growing in paddy fields requires careful water management. Rice is rich in carbohydrates and offers essential nutrients like magnesium, phosphorus, and B vitamins. It plays a crucial role in food security and is heavily relied upon for both subsistence and commercial agriculture.
weather: Requires hot and humid conditions with temperatures between 20-30°C.
soil_type: Clayey soil with good water retention.
water_requirements: High water requirement, preferably grown in flooded conditions.

name: Maize
details: Corn, or maize, originated in Central America and has since become one of the most widely grown crops worldwide. Its uses range from food to biofuel and livestock feed. The crop requires warm climates and plenty of sunlight, with varieties such as sweet corn, field corn, and popcorn. Corn is rich in carbohydrates and fiber, making it an essential energy source for both humans and animals.
weather: Warm temperatures between 18-27°C are ideal for corn growth.
soil_type: Well-drained fertile loamy soil.
water_requirements: Requires moderate watering during the growth stage.

name: Potato
details: Potato, a starchy tuber, is native to the Andean regions of South America. It thrives in cool climates and is a staple food in many parts of the world. The crop is valued for its versatility, as it can be mashed, fried, baked, or boiled. Potatoes are rich in vitamins like C and B6, and they are an excellent source of energy.
weather: Cool climates, with ideal growth between 10-20°C.
soil_type: Loose, well-drained, and fertile soil rich in organic matter.
water_requirements: Regular irrigation needed, especially during tuber formation.

name: Tomato
details: Tomatoes are versatile, warm-season crops cultivated globally for their fleshy, flavorful fruit. Originating in South America, they have become a dietary staple in many countries, used in salads, sauces, soups, and stews. Rich in vitamins C and A, tomatoes also contain antioxidants like lycopene, which may support heart health.
weather: Warm climates with temperatures between 20-25°C.
soil_type: Fertile, well-drained loamy soil rich in organic content.
water_requirements: Requires consistent moisture, but overwatering should be avoided.

name: Soybean
details: Soybean is a legume crop that is grown for its protein-rich seeds. It is a vital source of protein and oil and is widely used in animal feed, as well as in a variety of processed foods. Soybean is also used in the production of soy milk, tofu, and soy sauce. It is grown in temperate and tropical climates and is nitrogen-fixing, meaning it helps improve soil fertility.
weather: Prefers warm weather with temperatures between 20-30°C.
soil_type: Well-drained loamy soil rich in organic matter.
water_requirements: Requires moderate water, particularly during pod formation.

name: Barley
details: Barley is a hardy cereal grain that is grown in a wide range of climates. It is one of the first grains to be domesticated and is used in food production, brewing, and animal feed. Barley is rich in fiber and contains essential vitamins and minerals. It grows best in temperate climates and is often used as a rotation crop to improve soil health.
weather: Cool climates with temperatures between 15-20°C.
soil_type: Well-drained loamy soil.
water_requirements: Moderate water requirement, particularly during germination.

name: Millet
details: Millet is a group of small-seeded grasses cultivated primarily as cereal crops. They are drought-resistant and can be grown in a variety of soil conditions, making them suitable for regions with poor soils and low rainfall.
weather: Millet grows best in warm conditions, prefers 20 to 30°C.
soil_type: Well-drained sandy loam
water_requirements: Moderate watering during the growth stage.

name: Sorghum
details: Sorghum is a drought-tolerant cereal grain that is widely grown in arid and semi-arid regions. It is a major source of food, animal feed, and biofuel. Sorghum comes in many varieties, including sweet sorghum used for syrup production.
weather: Prefers warm temperatures of 20-35°C.
soil_type: Well-drained, fertile soil.
water_requirements: Low to moderate water requirement.

name: Oats
details: Oats are a versatile cereal grain often used in breakfast foods, baking, and animal feed. They thrive in cooler climates and are well-suited for growing in marginal soils. Oats are rich in dietary fiber and provide various health benefits.
weather: Cool climates, prefers 15-20°C.
soil_type: Well-drained sandy loam.
water_requirements: Moderate water, especially during seedling growth.

name: Mustard
details: Mustard, also known as rapeseed, is grown for its oil-rich seeds. It is used in cooking oils, margarine, and biodiesel production. Canola oil is known for its health benefits and is low in saturated fat.
weather: Prefers cool to moderate temperatures of 10-20°C.
soil_type: Well-drained fertile soil.
water_requirements: Moderate water requirement.

name: Sugarcane
details: Sugarcane is a tropical grass that is cultivated for its sweet juice, which is processed to produce sugar. It requires a warm climate and is grown in large plantations. Sugarcane is a major cash crop in many countries.
weather: Prefers hot, humid climates with temperatures between 20-32°C.
soil_type: Well-drained sandy or loamy soil.
water_requirements: High water requirement, particularly during growth stages.

name: Peas
details: Peas are a cool-season crop that can be grown for their edible seeds. They are rich in protein and fiber and are commonly used in soups, stews, and salads. Peas are nitrogen-fixing, which helps improve soil fertility.
weather: Grows best in cool conditions, prefers 10-20°C.
soil_type: Loamy soil with good drainage.
water_requirements: Moderate watering required during growth.

name: Chickpeas
details: Chickpeas, also known as garbanzo beans, are a drought-tolerant legume that is high in protein and fiber. They are used in a variety of dishes, including hummus and salads. Chickpeas thrive in warm climates and are grown extensively in India and the Middle East.
weather: Prefers warm temperatures of 20-30°C.
soil_type: Well-drained sandy or loamy soil.
water_requirements: Low to moderate water requirement.

name: Lentils
details: Lentils are small, lens-shaped legumes that are high in protein and fiber. They are commonly used in soups, stews, and salads. Lentils are drought-resistant and can thrive in poor soil conditions, making them an essential crop in many regions.
weather: Prefers cool climates, ideally 15-20°C.
soil_type: Loamy or sandy soil with good drainage.
water_requirements: Low water requirement, can tolerate dry conditions.

name: Cabbage
details: Cabbage is a leafy green vegetable that is widely cultivated around the world. It is rich in vitamins C and K and is used in salads, soups, and fermented products like sauerkraut. Cabbage prefers cooler temperatures and is typically grown in spring and autumn.
weather: Grows best in cool weather, around 15-20°C.
soil_type: Fertile, well-drained soil rich in organic matter.
water_requirements: Requires consistent moisture, but avoid waterlogging.

name: Spinach
details: Spinach is a leafy green vegetable known for its high nutritional value. It is rich in iron, vitamins, and antioxidants. Spinach can be grown in both cool and warm weather but is typically planted in early spring or autumn.
weather: Prefers cool weather, around 10-20°C.
soil_type: Loamy, well-drained soil rich in organic matter.
water_requirements: Moderate watering required, particularly in dry conditions.

name: Broccoli
details: Broccoli is a cruciferous vegetable that is rich in vitamins, minerals, and antioxidants. It is commonly used in cooking and is known for its health benefits. Broccoli prefers cooler temperatures and is typically grown in spring and autumn.
weather: Grows best in cool conditions, around 15-20°C.
soil_type: Fertile, well-drained soil rich in organic matter.
water_requirements: Requires consistent moisture, but avoid waterlogging.

details: Cauliflower is a popular cruciferous vegetable known for its white flower head. It is rich in vitamins and minerals and is used in a variety of dishes. Cauliflower prefers cool temperatures and can be grown in spring and autumn.

soil_type: Well-drained, fertile soil rich in organic matter.
water_requirements: Moderate watering required, particularly during growth.

soil_type: Well-drained, fertile soil.

soil_type: Fertile, well-drained soil rich in organic matter.
water_requirements: Requires consistent moisture, but avoid waterlogging.

details: Watermelon is a popular summer fruit known for its high water content and sweet flavor. It is a refreshing fruit commonly consumed in hot weather and is also used in salads and desserts. Watermelon prefers warm temperatures and is typically grown in the summer.

soil_type: Well-drained sandy or loamy soil.

soil_type: Well-drained, fertile soil.

soil_type: Well-drained, fertile soil.

soil_type: Well-drained sandy or loamy soil.

name: Cotton

weather: Prefers warm temperatures, around 25-35°C.
soil_type: Loamy, well-drained, and fertile soil.
water_requirements: Moderate to high; requires consistent moisture but not waterlogged conditions.

name: Coffee
details: Coffee is a popular beverage crop made from the roasted seeds of the Coffea plant. It is grown primarily in tropical climates and requires specific conditions for high-quality beans.
weather: Prefers mild temperatures, between 15-24°C, with some shade.
soil_type: Rich, well-drained soil with good organic content.
water_requirements: Requires regular watering, but not waterlogged; prefers high humidity.
growth_duration: 3-4 years for plants to mature and produce fruit, annual harvest after maturity

name: Tea
details: Tea is made from the leaves of the Camellia sinensis plant. It is a widely consumed beverage around the world, and it requires specific growing conditions, particularly in high-altitude regions.
weather: Prefers cool, subtropical climates, 18-30°C with ample rainfall.
season: Primarily spring and summer in most regions, can vary
soil_type: Acidic, well-drained soil rich in organic matter.
water_requirements: Requires ample rainfall; irrigation may be necessary in dry periods.
growth_duration: 3-5 years to maturity, multiple harvests each year

name: Mango
details: Mango is a tropical stone fruit known for its sweet and juicy pulp. It is rich in vitamins A and C and is widely cultivated in tropical and subtropical regions.
weather: Thrives in warm to hot climates, 24-30°C.
soil_type: Well-drained, slightly acidic soil with good organic content.
water_requirements: Requires moderate watering, particularly during flowering and fruiting stages.

name: Banana
details: Bananas are elongated, edible fruits produced by herbaceous plants. They are high in potassium and commonly consumed fresh or used in a variety of dishes.
weather: Prefers warm, humid climates, 26-30°C.
soil_type: Rich, well-drained loamy soil with high organic matter.
water_requirements: Requires abundant water, particularly during the growing season.

name: Strawberry

weather: Prefers cool to mild temperatures, 18-24°C.
soil_type: Sandy loam, well-drained and slightly acidic soil.
water_requirements: Requires regular moisture, particularly during fruit development.

name: Ginger
details: Ginger is a flowering plant whose rhizome is widely used as a spice and medicine. It has a pungent flavor and is known for its health benefits, including anti-inflammatory properties.
weather: Prefers warm, humid conditions, around 20-30°C.
soil_type: Loamy, well-drained, and fertile soil.
water_requirements: Requires consistent moisture but should not be waterlogged.

name: Garlic
details: Garlic is a bulbous plant in the onion family, known for its strong flavor and aroma. It is commonly used in cooking and is renowned for its health benefits, including antibacterial properties.
weather: Thrives in cool weather, around 13-24°C.
soil_type: Well-drained, fertile soil with good organic matter.
water_requirements: Moderate watering, particularly during dry periods.

name: Onion

weather: Prefers moderate temperatures, around 13-24°C.
soil_type: Well-drained, loamy soil with good fertility.

weather: Prefers cool climates, 15-20°C.
soil_type: Well-drained, fertile soil with a slightly acidic to neutral pH.

weather: Thrives in cool to moderate climates, 12-20°C.
soil_type: Well-drained, sandy loam soil with moderate fertility.
water_requirements: Moderate watering, ensuring soil remains moist.

name: Carrot
details: Carrots are a popular root vegetable known for their sweet taste and rich orange color. They are high in beta-carotene, fiber, and vitamins, especially vitamin A.
weather: Prefers cool climates, around 16-21°C.
soil_type: Loose, sandy loam soil that is well-drained and free of rocks.
water_requirements: Consistent moisture, particularly during the root development stage.

weather: Prefers Mediterranean climate, around 15-30°C.
season: Spring for flowering, harvest in late summer to early fall
soil_type: Well-drained, sandy loam soil with good organic matter.
water_requirements: Moderate watering, especially during dry spells and fruit development.
growth_duration: 5-7 years to start yielding after planting

name: Cashew
details: Cashews are kidney-shaped nuts that grow at the end of the cashew apple. They are rich in healthy fats and are widely consumed as snacks and used in cooking.
weather: Thrives in tropical climates, 24-28°C.
season: Flowers in winter and early spring, harvested in summer
soil_type: Sandy or lateritic soils with good drainage.

growth_duration: 3-5 years to start yielding after planting

name: Walnut

weather: Prefers temperate climates, 15-25°C.
season: Flowers in spring, harvest in autumn
soil_type: Well-drained, deep loam or sandy loam soil with high organic matter.

season: Can be harvested year-round in tropical regions.

name: Himalayan Raspberry
details: Himalayan raspberries are small, sweet, and juicy fruits that grow wild in the Himalayan region. They are rich in vitamins and antioxidants, commonly used in jams, desserts, and fresh salads.
weather: Thrives in cool temperate climates with adequate moisture.
soil_type: Well-drained, fertile soil with good organic matter.
water_requirements: Moderate; requires regular watering but is sensitive to waterlogging.
growth_duration: 1-2 years from planting to first harvest

name: Mulberry
details: Mulberries are sweet, juicy berries that come in various colors, including black, red, and white. They are often eaten fresh, dried, or used in jams and desserts.
weather: Grows well in temperate and subtropical climates.
soil_type: Well-drained, fertile soil with good organic matter.
water_requirements: Moderate; requires regular watering during dry periods.
growth_duration: 1-2 years from planting to first harvest

name: Gooseberry
details: Gooseberries are small, round, tart fruits that are green, yellow, or red. They are rich in vitamin C and are commonly used in jams, pies, and sauces.
weather: Grows best in temperate climates with well-defined seasons.
soil_type: Well-drained, sandy or loamy soil rich in organic matter.
water_requirements: Moderate; requires consistent moisture but is sensitive to overwatering.
growth_duration: 2-3 years from planting to first harvest

name: Turmeric
details: Turmeric is a flowering plant, known for its rhizome, which is used as a spice and a medicinal herb. It is famous for its bright yellow color and is commonly used in cooking, particularly in South Asian cuisine.
weather: Prefers warm, humid climates with temperatures around 20-30°C.
soil_type: Well-drained, loamy or sandy soil rich in organic matter.
water_requirements: Requires consistent moisture, especially during the growing period.

name: Coriander
details: Coriander is an annual herb known for its fresh leaves and seeds, widely used as a spice and garnish. The leaves are commonly used in salads, salsas, and various cuisines for flavor.
weather: Thrives in temperate climates; prefers cooler weather for growth.
soil_type: Well-drained, fertile soil with good organic content.
water_requirements: Moderate; requires regular watering but should not be waterlogged.

name: Green Chilli
details: Green chilli are young, unripe chili peppers known for their spicy flavor. They are used in various cuisines for seasoning and are rich in vitamins and antioxidants.
weather: Grows best in warm temperatures, ideally between 20-30°C.
soil_type: Well-drained, sandy or loamy soil rich in organic matter.
water_requirements: Moderate; requires regular watering, especially during dry spells.

name: Jute
details: Jute is a long, soft, and shiny vegetable fiber that can be spun into coarse, strong threads. It is primarily used to make burlap, hessian cloth, and sacks, and is known for its biodegradability.
weather: Grows best in warm, humid climates with temperatures around 25-35°C.
soil_type: Well-drained, fertile alluvial soil with high organic matter.
water_requirements: Requires consistent moisture, especially during the growing season.

name: Rubber
details: Rubber is harvested from rubber trees, which produce latex, a milky fluid used to make natural rubber. It is widely used in various products, including tires, footwear, and elastic materials.
weather: Thrives in tropical climates with temperatures between 25-35°C and high humidity.
soil_type: Deep, well-drained, loamy soil rich in organic matter.
water_requirements: Requires regular watering, especially during dry seasons.
growth_duration: 5-7 years for the tree to mature for latex production
yield: 500-700 kg of rubber per hectare per year after maturity

name: Apple
details: Apples are sweet, edible fruits produced by apple trees. They come in various colors and flavors, and are often eaten raw, baked, or made into cider.
weather: Prefers temperate climates with cold winters and warm summers.
soil_type: Well-drained, loamy soil rich in organic matter.
water_requirements: Moderate; regular watering needed during dry spells.
growth_duration: 4-5 years to start bearing fruit, with harvestable fruit after 6-7 months post-blossoming.

name: Grapes
details: Grapes are small, round fruits that grow in clusters on vines. They can be eaten raw or used to make wine, juice, and jams.
weather: Thrives in warm, sunny climates.
soil_type: Well-drained, sandy or loamy soil with good aeration.
water_requirements: Moderate; needs regular watering during dry periods.
growth_duration: 2-3 years for the vines to start producing fruit.

name: Cherry
details: Cherries are small, round fruits that can be sweet or sour. They are often used in desserts, preserves, and drinks.
weather: Prefers temperate climates with cold winters.
soil_type: Well-drained, fertile soil with good organic content.
water_requirements: Moderate; requires consistent moisture, especially during fruit development.

name: Sponge Gourd
details: Sponge gourd is a long, green vegetable known for its spongy texture. It is often used in stir-fries and soups and is valued for its nutritional benefits.
weather: Grows best in warm climates, ideally between 20-30°C.
soil_type: Well-drained, sandy or loamy soil rich in organic matter.
water_requirements: Moderate; needs regular watering, especially during dry spells.

name: Pointed Gourd
details: Pointed gourd is a green, elongated vegetable with a pointed end, commonly used in Indian and Asian cuisines. It is known for its mild flavor and nutritional value.
weather: Prefers warm weather, ideally between 20-30°C.
soil_type: Fertile, well-drained soil with good organic content.
water_requirements: Moderate; requires consistent moisture, especially during fruit formation.

name: Mint
details: Mint is a fragrant herb used in culinary dishes, teas, and for medicinal purposes. It has a refreshing flavor and is known for its digestive benefits.
weather: Thrives in moderate climates; prefers partial shade.
soil_type: Moist, well-drained soil rich in organic matter.
water_requirements: Moderate; requires regular watering to keep the soil moist.
growth_duration: 2-3 months to reach maturity, depending on the variety.

name: Rye
details: Rye is a cereal grain that is closely related to wheat and barley. It is known for its robustness and ability to thrive in poor soil conditions. Rye flour is commonly used for bread making.
weather: Prefers cool weather and can tolerate frost.
soil_type: Well-drained, sandy or loamy soil, tolerant of low soil fertility.
water_requirements: Moderate; drought-resistant once established.

name: Buckwheat
details: Buckwheat is a pseudocereal that is gluten-free and rich in nutrients. It is often used in pancakes, porridge, and as a grain substitute.
weather: Thrives in cooler temperatures and is sensitive to frost.
soil_type: Well-drained, fertile soil; prefers slightly acidic conditions.
water_requirements: Moderate; requires consistent moisture during the growing season.

name: Jackfruit
details: Jackfruit is a large tropical fruit with a spiky outer skin and sweet, fibrous flesh. It is often used in both sweet and savory dishes and is high in nutrients.
weather: Thrives in warm, humid climates; sensitive to frost.
soil_type: Well-drained, loamy soil rich in organic matter.
water_requirements: High; requires regular watering in dry conditions.
growth_duration: 3-4 years to bear fruit, with annual harvesting thereafter.

name: Olive
details: Olives are small, bitter fruits that are commonly used to produce olive oil. They are a staple in Mediterranean cuisine and are highly valued for their health benefits.
weather: Prefers mild winters and hot, dry summers; drought-tolerant.
soil_type: Well-drained, sandy or loamy soil, tolerant of low fertility.
water_requirements: Low; highly drought-resistant once established.

name: Passion Fruit
details: Passion fruit is a small, round fruit with a tangy pulp and edible seeds. It is commonly used in beverages, desserts, and jams.
weather: Grows best in warm, tropical or subtropical climates.
soil_type: Well-drained, fertile soil rich in organic matter.
water_requirements: Moderate; requires regular moisture, especially in dry periods.

name: Kiwi
details: Kiwi is a small, brown-skinned fruit with a sweet, tangy green flesh. It is rich in vitamin C and is eaten fresh or used in smoothies and desserts.
weather: Prefers temperate climates with cold winters.
soil_type: Well-drained, slightly acidic soil.
water_requirements: Moderate; requires consistent moisture.

name: Persimmon
details: Persimmon is a sweet, orange-colored fruit with a smooth texture. It is often eaten fresh or dried and is high in vitamins A and C.
weather: Prefers warm, temperate climates.
soil_type: Well-drained, loamy soil with good organic content.
water_requirements: Moderate; requires regular watering during dry spells.

name: Hog Plum
details: Hog plum is a small, sour fruit often used in chutneys and pickles. It is rich in vitamin C and has a unique tangy flavor.
weather: Grows well in warm, tropical climates.
soil_type: Well-drained, loamy soil with organic content.
water_requirements: Moderate; requires regular watering during dry periods.

name: Pineapple
details: Pineapple is a tropical fruit with a sweet, tangy taste. It is commonly eaten fresh, juiced, or used in desserts and is known for its vitamin C content.
weather: Thrives in warm, tropical climates with plenty of sunlight.
soil_type: Well-drained, sandy or loamy soil rich in organic matter.
water_requirements: Moderate; requires regular moisture but should not be waterlogged.

name: Custard Apple
details: Custard apple is a sweet, creamy fruit with a unique texture. It is rich in vitamins, minerals, and antioxidants.
weather: Grows best in warm, semi-tropical climates with moderate rainfall.
soil_type: Well-drained, sandy or loamy soil with good organic content.
water_requirements: Moderate; requires regular watering, especially during flowering.

name: Sapodilla
details: Sapodilla is a sweet, brown fruit with a grainy texture. It is often eaten fresh and is rich in vitamins and antioxidants.
weather: Thrives in warm, tropical to sub-tropical climates.
season: Year-round, with peak seasons in summer and winter.
soil_type: Well-drained, sandy or loamy soil.
water_requirements: Low to moderate; drought-tolerant once established.
